info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 11:38AM CDT until June 19 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas...
Slate Creek At Wellington affecting Sumner and Cowley Counties.
Little Arkansas River At Alta Mills affecting Harvey and Reno Counties.
Cottonwood River near Florence affecting Marion County.
Whitewater River at Towanda affecting Butler County.
Little Arkansas River Near Halstead affecting Harvey County.
Whitewater River at Augusta affecting Cowley and Butler Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cottonwood River near Florence.
* WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to Thursday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Outside the levee system in southeast Florence, flood waters flow across Park Ave Road and reach the foundation of a residential home. Northwest of Florence, the bridge on 140th Road and 1/2 mile west of Highway 77 floods.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 3.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 23.9 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 1145 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY AFTERNOON
